snippet.title: CAPTAIN AMERICA 4 Brave New World Trailer Breakdown | Easter Eggs, Hidden Details & More
snippet.description:
CAPTAIN AMERICA 4 Brave New World Trailer Breakdown | Easter Eggs, Hidden Details & More. In this video, we break down the brand new Captain America 4 Brave New World official teaser trailer that has just dropped. We will be going through it explaining what we think is going down and who the characters are, and going through the comics to compare and work out what we think will happen. Starring Anthony Mackie and Harrison Ford we can't wait to see what this movie has in store, so let's jump right into it and go through it all with a fine toothcomb on a massive green head. let's go!

Welcome to the heavy spoilers show I'm your host Paul and this video we're breaking down the trailer for Captain America, Brave New World.

-

Throughout this video we're gonna be going through the easter eggs, hidden details and things you might have missed. We'll also be talking about how it links in with the comics and what happens in the red hulk storyline.

I was supposed to be at the Deadpool and Wolverine early sneak peak screening today with Hugh Jackman and Ryan Reynolds but Marvel decided to drop this as well and unfortunately work gotta come first over me swanking about on a red carpet trying to pitch my squirrel girl movie. Hopefully you guys enjoy the breakdown though and please hit the thumbs up if you do.

With that out the way, thank you for clicking this, now lets get into a brave neeewww wooorrrlllld.

-

So this picks up in the aftermath of several things across the wider MCU. Theres plot threads here that have been dangling for decades and we're finally getting the return of some characters. The first of these includes Tim Blake Nelson who will be starring in the film as the leader. All the way back in the incredible hulk he got hit with some hulk blood. This has turned him into the big villain and it's gonna be interesting to see where we go with him. Liv Tyler is also back as Betty Ross and her fathers now being played by Harrisson Ford.

Covering Captain America 4 Brave New World Trailer Breakdown and Marvel Easter Eggs. Harrison Ford Thunderbolt Ross Red Hulk, Betty Ross returns from Incredible Hulk Movie and Edward Norton Hulk Easter Eggs. How Thunderbolt Ross becomes Red Hulk in the MCU. Thunderbolts Trailer. World War Hulk Movie Easter Eggs. The Leader from Incredible Hulk will be the main villain of Captain America 4 and how Thunderbolt Ross becomes US President after Secret Invasion.

Why Val wants Adamantium and Tiamat Celestial Body from The Eternals Ending. And how that sets up the Thunderbolts. And the Sentry Explained. Thunderbolts will be a direct continuation of the Captain America Brave New World Ending. It will also serve as an Avengers 5 Kang Dynasty Teaser for the New Avengers Team. Marvel MCU Reboot Plans Explained. What Happened to Marvel, Marvel Phase 4 post Avengers Endgame, Disney Plus Streaming problems, and Fixing Marvel.

Deadpool and Wolverine Trailer Connection. Wolverine vs Hulk, More Cameo Scenes, Sabretooth Returns, Wolverine vs Sabretooth. Deadpool vs Disney Jokes, Kevin Feige Marvel Jokes and 4th Wall Breaks. Why Marvel is rebooting the MCU, all the marvel movies and disney plus marvel tv shows with Avengers 6 Secret Wars. And what's going to change with all the Avengers, New Iron Man, X-Men Mutants like Wolverine, Deadpool, Fantastic Four, Ghost Rider, Spider-Man and other characters marvel previous had not been able to use the way they wanted in previous movies.

Deadpool 3 Trailer and other Cameo Scenes. Deadpool vs TVA Agents, Wolverine Yellow Suit. Fantastic Four Cameo Scenes and Connections. Original X-Men Return, Jean Grey Phoenix, Storm, Magneto, Professor X. House Of M Easter Eggs. Wolverine Variants, X-Men, X-Force Explained. How Deadpool 3 and Wolverine change the Fox Marvel Movies

Hugh Jackman Wolverine, MCU Wolverine Explained. Avengers 6 Secret Wars Teaser and the future of Wolverine and X-Men in the MCU. There will be more funny Deadpool vs Wolverine videos, Ryan Reynolds Hugh Jackman videos that they make in between movies

snippet.title: Ethos, Pathos, and Logos — The Art of Persuasion Explained
snippet.description:
Ethos vs Pathos vs Logos — We look at how to persuade your audience with three tools from Aristotle.

Ethos, Pathos, and Logos Explained ►► https://bit.ly/45GMsQC
Subscribe to StudioBinder Academy ►► https://bit.ly/sb-ad
StudioBinder Blog ►► http://bit.ly/sb-bl

─────────────────────

Chapters:
00:00 - Introduction to Ethos, Pathos, and Logos
00:42 - Ethos, Pathos, and Logos Definition
03:18 - Chapter 1: Ethos
08:00 - Chapter 2: Pathos
12:50 - Chapter 3: Logos
17:20 - Chapter 4: Real-world Example
19:00 - Takeaways

─────────────────────

THE ART OF PERSUASION

Nothing feels better than winning an argument. Luckily, Ancient Greek philosopher Aristotle gifted us with what is referred to as the rhetorical triangle– three rhetorical tools which act as the basis of nearly any good argument. If you’re looking to persuade an audience, look no further. We walk through what goes into a good piece of persuasion.

ETHOS

Ethos focuses on establishing the credibility of the speaker or writer. This is achieved by presenting yourself as knowledgeable, trustworthy, and ethical. Credibility can be built through experience and expertise— for example, a doctor speaking about the benefits of a particular medication uses their medical background to enhance their credibility. Without ethos, arguments may lack authority and fail to convince an audience of the speaker's trustworthiness.

PATHOS

Pathos aims to evoke an emotional response from the audience. By appealing to emotions such as fear, anger, or joy, speakers can deeply connect with their listeners. Advertisements often use pathos by showing heartwarming scenes to evoke empathy and persuade viewers to buy a product. Pathos is incredibly powerful: it taps into human values and desires, influencing decision-making through emotional engagement.

LOGS

Logos refers to appealing to the audience's sense of reason and logic. This is typically  done through presenting logical arguments, facts, and evidence. Think of scientific papers, which rely heavily on logos to support their claims with data and experiments. Without logical reasoning, arguments can appear weak or unsubstantiated, failing to convince an audience grounded in rationality.

THREE PERSUASIVE APPEALS

Ethos, pathos, and logos are essential to persuasive communication, each serving distinct purposes in influencing an audience. Effective communicators often blend these strategies to create compelling arguments that resonate intellectually and emotionally. 

Understanding and mastering these techniques can enhance one's ability to persuade and convey ideas effectively in various contexts, from filmmaking to writing and advertising. By leveraging ethos, pathos, and logos appropriately, communicators can craft messages that not only inform but also inspire and persuade audiences to take action or adopt a particular viewpoint.


#FilmTheory #VideoEssay #Filmmaking

snippet.title: How to Write Compelling Dialogue: A Proven Process
snippet.description:
Compelling dialogue that immerses your reader in your story is not easy to write. 

The good news is that, like any other writing skill, the more you work at it, the better you should get. 

With nearly 200 books under my belt, two-thirds of which are novels, I’ve learned the ins and outs of dialogue writing. And I want to help you avoid the errors I’ve made so you can write dialogue that captivates readers. 

In this short video, I break down dialogue writing step by step. 

I explore:

- 6 steps to writing dialogue like a pro
- How dialogue helps your novel flow 
- How to format dialogue 
- The cardinal sin of writing dialogue 
- And much more

To help you tighten your dialogue even further, click the following link for the FREE Self-editing bonus guide I mention in the video. 

https://bit.ly/33OLemK

And jumpstart your writing journey with my complete (and free) novel-writing guide. 
https://leveragecreative.lpages.co/how-to-write-a-novel-landing-yt/

Yours for better writing,

Jerry

snippet.title: Show Don't Tell: What You Need to Know
snippet.description:
Do you know this cardinal rule of writing?

It’s easy to tell readers what’s happening. 

But telling doesn’t evoke emotion or involves readers in the story experience.  

Writing “It was cold” simply informs. 

Writing “Bill raised his collar, turned his face away from the biting wind, and thrust his hands deep into his pockets” engages the readers’ senses and allows them to deduce the weather.

That’s why “Show, Don’t Tell” has become one of the cardinal rules of writing. 

In this video, you'll learn:

- How to appeal to readers’ senses
- How effective dialogue aids in showing
- How to resist the urge to explain
- Examples of how to do this right 
- And more

Need more writing advice? Check out my free self-editing checklist! https://leveragecreative.lpages.co/self-editing-checklist-landing-yt/

snippet.title: Creative Writing 101
snippet.description:
Have you ever thought about trying creative writing?

Maybe you love to tell stories or have been told you have a way with words, but you’ve never known where to start writing them down.

This introductory creative writing lesson covers all the essential elements of good stories, different types of creative writing, as well as some basic ideas and tips to get you started.

Miss the webinar? Watch the replay here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8pFw9aUDyYU

Watch Jerry ferociously edit two submissions (fiction and nonfiction) from writers like you at this LIVE webinar. He’ll be brutally honest (but kind) and show exactly what needs to change and why.

Take Jerry’s writing assessment here: https://jerryjenkins.com/quiz/

[05:58] Plot

snippet.title: 5 Tips to Mastering First-Person Point of View
snippet.description:
You’ve told stories in the first person, using I, me, and my, since you were a child. It’s the simplest way to relay an experience.

But simple doesn’t mean easy.

In this video, Jerry Jenkins shares his tips for writing in first person point of view. 

Writing Assessment: https://jerryjenkins.com/quiz/

Blog: https://jerryjenkins.com/blog/

Need more help crafting the perfect protagonist? Download Jerry’s FREE Character Arc Worksheet: https://leveragecreative.lpages.co/character-arc-worksheet-landing-yt/

[00:29] What is Point of View?
[01:01] The cardinal rule of Point of View
[02:27] Why Use the First-Person Point of View?
[03:40] 5 Tips for Writing in First Person
[03:50] 1. Avoid head-hopping
[04:30] 2. Craft a strong voice
[05:03] 3. Don’t switch tenses

snippet.title: A Guide to Writing in Third-Person Point of View
snippet.description:
Third-person limited point of view is most common in storytelling—and with good reason.

While first-person may be the easiest POV for readers to understand, because that makes it easier to avoid head hopping, third-person is one you want to learn to grasp and effectively employ.

snippet.title: Internal and External Conflict: The Engine of Fiction
snippet.description:
To fully invest readers in your story, it must contain conflict.  

And for your characters to grow and feel authentic, they must face obstacles—internally as well as externally.

Without facing both inner and outer conflict, they will feel flat—even to you. 

I’ve been writing for more than 50 years, and I’ve sharpened techniques for writing compelling conflict to keep readers riveted. 

In this short video, I discuss:

- 5 questions to answer about your characters
- Examples of effective conflict 
- A cardinal sin of writing 
- The trouble with perfect heroes
- The importance of Character Arc 
- And more

Click here to access the worksheet mentioned in the video: https://bit.ly/3dMV2mQ

And jumpstart your writing journey with my complete (and free) novel-writing guide: https://leveragecreative.lpages.co/how-to-write-a-novel-landing-yt/

Need more help developing your characters? Check out Jerry's free Character Arc Worksheet!  https://leveragecreative.lpages.co/character-arc-worksheet-landing-yt/

snippet.title: How to Write a Novel: My Proven 12-Step Process
snippet.description:
In this video, I share with you the 12-step novel-writing process that’s helped me write more than 130 novels over the past 40 years.

Even if you’re a beginner, you can use this plan to write the best fiction you can imagine and avoid years of trial-and-error.

You’ll learn…

- The fool-proof story structure I use for all my novels
- Three questions to ask yourself about each potential character in your novel
- Four types of openers you can use for your story
- The engine of fiction (If your scenes fall flat, I guarantee you need this)
- One thing that will make or break you as a novelist
- And more!

Click this link to get your bonus editing checklist: https://leveragecreative.lpages.co/self-editing-checklist-landing-yt/

And here's another surprise bonus, my complete (and free) novel-writing guide: https://leveragecreative.lpages.co/how-to-write-a-novel-landing-yt/

snippet.title: How to Write a Book: 13 Steps From a Bestselling Author
snippet.description:
Have you ever had a book idea so captivating you just knew it would finally push you across the finish line?

But, like most, you soon ran out of steam and had no idea where to go next? 

Writers fail not because of their writing—but because of a lack of preparation.

In this video I distill my 40+ years of experience into 17 minutes packed with some of my best advice.

You’ll discover:

- How to avoid feeling overwhelmed

- How to know your book idea is big enough

- How to finally start meeting your own deadlines

- Four types of compelling openers—and how to choose the best for you 

- How conflict keeps readers turning pages (yes, even in nonfiction)

- The #1 reason agents and publishers reject manuscripts 

- How research keeps your book credible

- And much more

For more help, click the following links to download my FREE guides: 

How to Maximize your Writing Time: https://leveragecreative.lpages.co/writing-time-landing-yt/
How to Write a Novel a 12-Step Guide: https://leveragecreative.lpages.co/how-to-write-a-novel-landing-yt/
Ultimate Self-Editing Checklist: https://leveragecreative.lpages.co/self-editing-checklist-landing-yt/

snippet.title: PLEASE Don't Make Dragons Boring!
snippet.description:
Chromatic Dragons. Big scary monsters that drastically affect your world, right? Well, many GM's forget that dragons keep existing while your players aren't engaged in a dragon-based quest. How do D&D's evil dragons shape the worlds they inhabit?

#dnd #worldbuilding #ttrpg #dragons 

Credits:
The Grungeon Master logo,  and intro music were composed by the wonderful Janina Arndt!
Find her here: https://twitter.com/JaninaArndt

snippet.title: Why Do Fantasy Races Live So Long?
snippet.description:
Today, let's think about longevity in Fantasy RPGs; its worldbuilding implications, and the potential biology that could allow for such things. 

#dnd #worldbuilding #ttrpg

snippet.title: Do Fantasy Pantheons Make Sense?
snippet.description:
How does Polytheism function? Why do so many Fantasy worlds seek to emulate it? And do they do a good job at doing so? Let's discuss Worldbuilding, Fantasy, and Faith, and why Fantasy style Polytheism is such a strange concept.

#dnd  #fantasy #history  #worldbuilding #religion #ttrpg #polytheism 

Credits:
The Grungeon Master Logo and background music were designed by the wonderful Janina Arndt. Find her here: https://twitter.com/JaninaArndt
